# One-way Analysis of Variance (ANOVA)

### ANOVA hypotheses

Null hypothesis: the means of each group are equal.
Alternative hypothesis: at least one of the group means is not equal to the others.

### ANOVA assumptions

- independence of observations
- approximately normally distributed
- homogeneity of variance (variances are equal)

```{r}
aov.fit <- aov(weight ~ group, data = PlantGrowth)
summary(aov.fit)

TukeyHSD(aov.fit)
```
